related_questions.question: What is an affiliate under Rule 144?
related_questions.snippet: Rule 144(a)(3) identifies what sales produce restricted securities. Control securities are those held by an affiliate of the issuing company. An affiliate is a person, such as an executive officer, a director or large shareholder, in a relationship of control with the issuer.16 ene. 2013
related_questions.title: Rule 144: Selling Restricted and Control Securities - SEC.gov

related_questions.question: What is the Rule 144 holding period?
related_questions.snippet: Rule 144 requires a selling security holder to hold shares of a non-reporting company for one year after the securities are fully paid for. Generally, the holding period commences once the securities are fully paid for.

related_questions.question: What is a 144 filer?
related_questions.snippet: An executive officer, director, or affiliate of a company must file SEC Form 144: Notice of Proposed Sale of Securities with the Securities and Exchange Commission or SEC when placing an order to sell that company's stock during any three-month period in which the sale exceeds 5,000 shares or units or has an aggregate ...14 abr. 2019
related_questions.title: SEC Form 144 Overview - Investopedia

related_questions.question: What is the difference between Rule 144 and 144a?
related_questions.snippet: Rule 144A has become the principal safe harbor on which non-U.S. companies rely when accessing the U.S. capital markets. ... Rule 144A should not be confused with Rule 144, which permits public (as opposed to private) unregistered resales of restricted and controlled securities (within certain limits.)
related_questions.title: SEC Rule 144A - Wikipedia

answer_box.title: Affiliates | Rule 144 Solutions
answer_box.snippet: Rule 144 at (a)(1) defines an “affiliate” of an issuing company as a person that directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, such issuer.”

organic_results.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Rule 144 and Rule 145
organic_results.snippet: There are five basic requirements of Rule 144, although not all requirements apply to every sale. Affiliates of the issuer must comply with all five requirements.
